How can I change the MySQL password?: How can I change the MySQL password?
Open the application Terminal and type:: Open the application Terminal and type:
Afterwards, you also need to change the: Afterwards, you also need to change the password for phpMyAdmin and other scripts which are used with MAMP.
You can change the password for phpMyAdm: You can change the password for phpMyAdmin in the file /Applications/MAMP/bin/phpMyAdmin/config.inc.php.
Where can I change the ports for Apache: Where can I change the ports for Apache and MySQL?
You can change the ports in the preferen: You can change the ports in the preferences of the MAMP program:
Where should I save my HTML and PHP page: Where should I save my HTML and PHP pages?
By default, PHP and HTML Pages should be: By default, PHP and HTML Pages should be copied to the htdocs folder which is located in /Applications/MAMP.
You can change the path for the Document: You can change the path for the Document Root folder in the preferences of the MAMP program:
Why does MAMP ask me for a password when: Why does MAMP ask me for a password when it is starting or stopping the servers?
You probably have set the Apache port to: You probably have set the Apache port to 1024 or lower.
On a Unix system like Mac OS X you must: On a Unix system like Mac OS X you must have root permissions to start IP services with ports smaller than 1024.
<b>MAMP</b> and <b>MAMP PRO</b> are deve: MAMP and MAMP PRO are developed and distributed by %s.
No News available at the moment!: No news available at the moment!
My PHP scripts need more resources to ru: My PHP scripts need more resources to run. Changing the PHP.ini file did not seem to work, what can I do?
You must always use the template functio: You must always use the template functions of MAMP PRO to edit the configuration files of the MAMP subsystem.
If can change them bypassing MAMP PRO yo: If you change them bypassing MAMP PRO your changes will most likely be ignored or overwritten the next time the servers start.
Use the submenu of the File->Edit Templa: Use the submenu of the File->Edit Template->PHP menu to select the PHP.ini file you want to change.
All this holds also true for other parts: All this holds also true for other parts of MAMP. Use the corresponding submenu to modify the Apache, MySQL or Postfix config files.
In the template editing window do not mo: In the template editing window do not modify or delete the placeholders starting with and ending in "MAMP". This could break some or all functions of MAMP PRO.
Switch to the MySQL tab and click &quot;: Switch to the MySQL tab and click "Change password".
Type the new password twice. Click &quot: Type the new password twice. Click "Change" to save it. This will also automatically save the password to phpMyAdmin.
You still need to change the MySQL passw: You still need to change the MySQL password in your own scripts though.
You change the ports in the General tab: You change the ports in the General tab of the MAMP PRO program:
I get an error when I try to start Apach: I get an error when I try to start Apache and MySQL but the error logs are empty. What can I do to identify the problem?
This seems to be due to incorrect rights: This seems to be due to incorrect rights settings. Make sure that the rights of the log file you selected are set correctly.
You can apply necessary changes in the F: You can apply necessary changes in the Finder using the Information dialog or in the application "Terminal" using the commands chown and chmod.
You can change the path for the Document: You can change the path for the Document Root folder in the hosts section of MAMP PRO:
XYZ does not appear in the Extras list. Why is it not available?
Please make sure that your host settings: Please make sure that your host settings meet the minimum requirements of XYZ (PHP version, disk space, etc.) and that your computer is connected to the Internet.
If XYZ still does not show up in the Ext: If XYZ still does not show up in the Extras list it might (still) not be available as an Extra. We are making more and more Extras available over time.
You can always make a feature request so: You can always make a feature request so we know which Extras we should tackle next.
